paragraphs.text:
%md
## This section shows you how to access files in your local file system and MapR Filesystem by using shell commands in your Apache Zeppelin notebook.
[MapR Data Science Refinery Documentation](https://mapr.com/docs/61/Zeppelin/ZeppelinShell.html)

#### Pre-requisistes
To use POSIX shell commands to access MapR Filesystem, you must have a MapR Filesystem mount point in your container. The [FUSE-Based POSIX Client](https://mapr.com/docs/61/Zeppelin/ZeppelinDockerRunParameters.html#concept_rhn_gb2_rbb__section_i4r_5c2_rbb) provides this functionality.

In the following example, your MapR Filesystem mount point is in `/mapr` and your cluster name is `node3.cluster.com`. You can find the name of your cluster in the file `/opt/mapr/conf/mapr-clusters.conf` on your MapR cluster.

msg.data:
This section shows you how to access files in your local file system and MapR Filesystem by using shell commands in your Apache Zeppelin notebook.

MapR Data Science Refinery Documentation

Pre-requisistes

To use POSIX shell commands to access MapR Filesystem, you must have a MapR Filesystem mount point in your container. The FUSE-Based POSIX Client provides this functionality.

In the following example, your MapR Filesystem mount point is in /mapr and your cluster name is node3.cluster.com. You can find the name of your cluster in the file /opt/mapr/conf/mapr-clusters.conf on your MapR cluster.

paragraphs.title: 1. Create a file of test data in `/tmp`:
paragraphs.text:
%sh
cat > /tmp/test.data << EOF
John,Smith
Brian,May
Rodger,Taylor
John,Deacon
Max,Plank
Freddie,Mercury
Albert,Einstein
Fedor,Dostoevsky
Lev,Tolstoy
Niccolo,Paganini
EOF

msg.data:
John,Smith
Brian,May
Rodger,Taylor
John,Deacon
Max,Plank
Freddie,Mercury
Albert,Einstein
Fedor,Dostoevsky
Lev,Tolstoy
Niccolo,Paganini

paragraphs.title: 2.1. Copy the file to your home directory in MapR Filesystem (/user/mapr) use FUSE-Based POSIX Client and display the contents of the file:
2.2. Copy the file to your home directory in MapR Filesystem (/user/mapr) use Hadoop commands and display the contents of the file:

paragraphs.text:
%md 
In this short tutorial, we have seen how easy MapR Data Science Refinery works with the cluster's filesystem.

msg.data: In this short tutorial, we have seen how easy MapR Data Science Refinery works with the cluster’s filesystem.
